messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Yes, ma'am. I'm at a school on 2nd Avenue, and there’s a gentleman here saying the police are coming and he's going to start shooting.
Okay, do not let anyone into the building, including the police. Stay on the line with me. Where are you in the building?
I'm in the front office.
He just went outside and started shooting.
Can you get somewhere safe?
I'll try, but he might see me. I have to call you back.
Hold on. Put the phone down.
She said she's getting the police now to tell them to back off, okay?
Okay. Stop all movement on the ground.
If it's not an emergency, please do not use the radio.
Are you talking to the shooter?
That's what he's telling me to say on the radio.
Okay, and what did you want me to tell the police, sir?
He told me to call the news. He's not mentally stable.
Alright, stay on the line with me.
He said he's on probation, and if he gives his name, he's going away for a long time.
Can you ask if he's willing to give his name?
He said no.
Okay, can you stay on the line and talk to him?
He said he's not mentally stable and regrets not going to the hospital.
I can let them know that you have not tried to harm anyone if that helps.
He wants to know if he walks out with me, will they shoot him?
Tell him to stay put and I will get an okay from them.
He said to evacuate the nearby homes.
Okay. Ask him if he's willing to give up his weapon.
He said if they come armed, he's going to start shooting again.
Okay. He said he wants to go to the hospital.
He put his weapon down. Is it safe for the officers to come in?
Yes, he's lying on the ground with his hands behind his back.
Tell him to stay calm. The officers are coming in.
I love you, and I’m proud of you for giving up.
You're doing great. Tell him the officers are coming in now.
He wants to know if he can drink his water.
Yes, that's fine. Just keep him calm.
He said he was with the Inner Harbor kids playing drums for Red Women Week.
Alright, the officers are on their way in now.
He said the gun may come back as stolen, but it's not.
That's okay. Just keep everything calm. The officers will sort it out.
He said he has no more weapons on him.
Good, tell him to stay where he is until the officers get there.
He’s laying on the ground with his hands behind his back.
You're doing great. Stay calm and wait for the officers.
Okay. They’re here. Thank you, ma'am.
You're welcome. Stay safe.
